DOC.brief_summary: An analgesia protocol for acute renal colic will lead to faster significant reductions in pain than prior practice.
DOC.brief_title: An Analgesia Protocol for Acute Renal Colic in the Emergency Department
DOC.detailed_description: A retrospective study was performed that assessed the time to significant analgesia and medications used to achieve analgesia in the DHMC ED. Based upon this a prospective pain management protocol was designed and we will track the difference in time to significant pain relief between the two groups.
DOC.criteria: Kidney stone on stone protocol CT scan Acute pain from a kidney stone Age < 18 or > 65 Pregnant women Contraindications to NSAID's or opiates
DOC.keyword: Renal colic, pain, protocol, emergency department
